item.title: Hello World
item.description: This is the first ever post for the third iteration of my personal website that now features blogging thanks to the excellent Hugo static site generator. In this post I want to explain my thoughts about what should go on the site, touch on some of the technologies used to build the site, and briefly discuss my thoughts on the look of the site. What should go on the website? The software engineer/developer portfolio websites I have seen usually look similar to a resume, with sections such as “work experience”, “education”, “skills”, etc.

item.title: Directory
item.description: Blogs eli.thegreenplace.net - Eli Bendersky’s personal website mtlynch.io - Michael Lynch’s personal website sohamkamani.com - Soham Kanami’s blog, features some excellent examples and tutorials for Golang engineering.atspotify.com - Spotify Engineering Blog Educational bulletin.engin.umich.edu/courses/eecs/ - University of Michigan EECS course guide open.umich.edu - University of Michigan open course material ocw.mit.edu - MIT Open Courseware learnxinyminutes.com - Quick tours of selected algorithms, data structures, languages, and tools betterexplained.com - Excellent math explainers gobyexample.
